instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U6100: What is U6100? this is an SPI ROM chip that holds the BIOS which is necessary for the machine to POST or try and power on..
definitions.U1950: What is U1950? This chip often becomes corroded on pin 8 on the PP3V42_G3H pin causing PM_SLP_S4_L to go missing.
definitions.PLT_RESET_L: What is PLT_RESET_L? PLT_RESET_L is platform reset, this signal keeps the system from POSTing. _L means the signal is asserted when its voltage is low. .
definitions.PLT_RESET: What is PLT_RESET? PLT_RESET stands for platform reset. When this is asserted the machine will not POST. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> S0 rails pulsing
threads.message:
Got this board, no liquid damage. 


Green/orange light, fan try to spin and s0 rails pulsing. ALL SYS  also pulses. Already checked all traces on <CHIP>U6100</CHIP> and resistors on SPI Bus Series Termination and all are ok. No visible damage. 


My guess is <CHIP>U6100</CHIP> but i dont have medusa for now. Anyway to check if there is something else or it is defenitly EFI?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> S0 rails pulsing
threads.message:
To suspect SPI, you should get pulse at <SIGNAL>PLT_RESET_L</SIGNAL> first.
Do you get pulse at pins 7 & 3 of <CHIP>U1950</CHIP>?
VCORE pulsing too?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> S0 rails pulsing
threads.message:
Yes, PIn 7 and 3 are pulsing up to 3.3. and Vcore is also pulsing to 1.05V.


P.S. when i measure pin 7 on <CHIP>U1950</CHIP> sometimes fan spins and but there is no image. :S


Same happened when measered PLT RESET, but when not starting PLR doesnt pulse

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> S0 rails pulsing
threads.message: Test removing <CHIP>U8130</CHIP>...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> S0 rails pulsing
threads.message: without <CHIP>U8130</CHIP> fan spins, doesnt stop, but nothing getting warm.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> S0 rails pulsing
threads.message: Try good BIOS now...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> S0 rails pulsing
threads.message: well, as i have not medusa, will buy chip and once it arrived will back with result, Thanks

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> S0 rails pulsing
threads.message: I have just found that <CHIP>U8005</CHIP> had corrosion. Changed it and now fan stopped spinning.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> S0 rails pulsing
threads.message:
"will buy chip "
What chip???
Don't you have normal programmer to flash <CHIP>U6100</CHIP>, once removed from MLB?

Solder back <CHIP>U8130</CHIP> (after changed <CHIP>U8005</CHIP>) and try again.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> S0 rails pulsing
threads.message:
i dont have programmer, because i dont have many efi issues macs. Usually i buy clear efi and never had problem with that.


P.S: Soldered back <CHIP>U8130</CHIP> and nothing happens now.


Main S0 rails pulsing, without <CHIP>U8005</CHIP> fan spins (just spins)

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> S0 rails pulsing
threads.message:
[USER=682]@2informaticos[/USER] you still think its bios with this symptoms?
<SIGNAL>PLT_RESET</SIGNAL>  not pulsing

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> S0 rails pulsing
threads.message:
Shouldn't be BIOS; <SIGNAL>PLT_RESET_L</SIGNAL> is required before PCH accesses <CHIP>U6100</CHIP>.
Board stays on w/ <CHIP>U8005</CHIP> and w/o <CHIP>U8130</CHIP>?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> S0 rails pulsing
threads.message: When <CHIP>U8005</CHIP> is removed fan spins but no image no chime.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> S0 rails pulsing
threads.message: <SIGNAL>PP1V05_S0SW_PCH_HSIO</SIGNAL> is shorting to ground when i put <CHIP>U8005</CHIP>

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> S0 rails pulsing
threads.message:
What is the exact ohm value?
Did you check it w/o <CHIP>U8005</CHIP> too?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> S0 rails pulsing
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PP1V05_S0SW_PCH_HSIO</SIGNAL> short disappeared, seems that <CHIP>U8005</CHIP> was soldered bad. Now With and without resistance to ground - 450 Ohms

and like before: with <CHIP>U8005</CHIP> no fan spin without fan spins.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> S0 rails pulsing
threads.message: Do you get at least voltage pulse at  <SIGNAL>PP1V05_S0SW_PCH_HSIO</SIGNAL> ?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> S0 rails pulsing
threads.message: yes, it is pulsing up to 1.05 and goes down every few seconds.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> S0 rails pulsing
threads.message: Did you try SMC bypass?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> S0 rails pulsing
threads.message: Yes, smc by pass first make fan spins for 1 second than stops, and than fan making "clicks" trying to sping but not spinning.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> S0 rails pulsing
threads.message:
When <CHIP>U8130</CHIP> renoved, <SIGNAL>PLT_RESET_L</SIGNAL> stays high?
If yes, try BIOS  then...

threads.message: Will check it later today and post result. Thanks
